These were slightly pungent by themselves, but the lemon sauce punched them up perfectly, like a counter-weight, adding some acid to the mix to balance the flavors.  I'd have some more, please.  Though I skipped it, the hommos looked creamy and fresh, and even the small order seemed enormous on the plates of other diners.  Wraps with shwarma or kafka looked huge and give me something to consider next time.  There are also daily lunch specials the owner, Izzat, will happily show you.  Braised lamb shank looked strong once unveiled, if that's you thing.  Gotta love the mix of regional flavors coming out of East Charlotte right now.  Asian, Latin American, Indian, and Middle Eastern: all are well-represented here.  Now if only it weren't such a trek to go explore.  Luckily, LSK makes it worth the trip.
The lamb shank is delicious. The side dishes are too! The owner has always been friendly and you can tell he takes pride in the food and service at his restaurant.

Visited couple weeks ago on Thursday after early voting. All positive reviews for this establishment!! Ordered many dishes and all were beyond great. Owner is super nice and friendly and went out of his way to satisfy us, he knew it was our 1st visit. So glad I chose to come here rather than other Mediterranean establishments in Charlotte. Can't wait to go back!

You might as well 'roll up' (insert Big Pimpin' here) because when you're done, you will need to be rolled out. Made the trek south for a day in the QC, specifically b/c I was needing some ethnic food to satisfy an itch. Based on all the great reviews, THIS was my go-to, must try spot.   Hubs and I took the ankle biters and enjoyed the following:  Appetizer Sampler, $6.99, choice of three apps. We selected the hummus, fallafel and dolmas Kgrape leaves.) All were very good. The fresh pita is the best I've had since Idunnowhen.   Various imported drinks, all well priced and really good.  Lamb Shank special, $9.99, with choice of side and soup/salad. Where the heck can you get lamb shank for under $10bucks????????? Hubs enjoyed this, as did the one year old ankle biter. Salad is light and fresh, served w/a light, lemon-y house made dressing.  Chicken Kabob entree, $7.99, w/choice of side and soup/salad. Looked, smelled and tasted like the food that fed my belly and soul as a kid growing up surrounded by Greeks, Turks and Armenians. Delicious.   Izzat, the owner, was very friendly, quick to reccomend and clearly has a lot of experience in the industry. The set-up is simple and a bit shabby, but you are there to feast and that you do. You are served on platters (PLATTERS!!!!) and will most definitely have more than enough to take home. The four of us devoured our food. They musta thought we hadn't eaten for days. Thank gawd many eastern cultures use their bread (pita) as a utensil - I didn't look like a *total* barbarian.   So why not four stars? One major point: the owner smoked while standing at the counter, next to our table....in the restaurant....which is illegal...and I was with two asthmatics....and I loathe cigarette smoke. My other nitpick: my food was delicious but the rice was barely warm. That said, we had enough really good food to easily feed six people (though with just four we can delight in leftovers) for $32 smackers! NICE!

super!!! I am a bit of a critic when it comes to good Middle Eastern food especially since I have some of the best cooks in my family.  The "special rice" is a must order.  It is so savory and literally melts your mouth. The vegetarian selection here is awesome!    The man who own this place is a hoot!  The first time I came in he had his adorable little daughter at the counter and the interaction between the two of them was priceless.  I have been coming at least 3 times per week!  You will not find a better place to delight your tastebuds!

This place is my JAM! Thankfully, I'm located less than 2 minutes from this little gem of a place and since discovering it on 9/29, I've been 6 times. That's right - 6 times in 8 days.  I can't get enough of their falafel wrap, and let me explain why:  1. 2.99 - with tax, total comes out to $3.64 2. Falafel is so moist, yet perfectly fried - it's a miracle and sin all in one 3. The salad they put on it is always fresh, light and cool 4. Please see #1 & #2 5. Izzat is always there and while I can't understand a word of what he says over the phone, when I walk in he is always smiling and asking after my health (Perhaps he wants to be sure I am in good health so I can continue to put his kids through college thanks to the rate at which he sees me). 6. Please see #1-5  So yes, I am in LURVE with this place and you should definitely try it. I've also had the grape leaves (good, salty though!), the hummos (home run, all the way, amazing) and the Babaganoush (yummy). An accomplice on one of my visits tried the Chicken wrap and before I could ask for a bite it was gone, so that also says something ;)  As others have said, don't let the shanty strip mall it's in get you down - this really is a very real, honest establishment that appears to really hold onto their roots and rock the Casbah of tastebuds in my mouth!

Can't believe this place doesn't have more reviews. We tried  the falafal wrap, chicken shawarma and the kafta kabob wrap. All three were excellent and exactly what we were hoping for. The kafta is a must try in my opinion and the owner was so nice!
Every time I dine here, it's delicious!  The Schwerma and mixed meat plate combined with garlic sauce is to die for!

I had fairly high expectations going in, and I'm so glad La Shish Kabob did not disappoint.  I plan to make many future trips to this little place.  My partner and I both had the lamb kabob wrap.  Inside, the lamp was so tender and wonderfully flavored.  I can't quite figure out what the spices are.  The hummus and the veggies inside were delicious.  I also had the falafel - I just loved the flavor, and the texture was perfectly crispy on the outside but soft on the inside.    My decor inside was not much, of course- just a few tables you can sit at.  Very plain decor and limited seating, but it's a good place to get take away.  The prices are very affordable; our wraps were $5 each and we got an 8 count falafel for $4.  All our food was made fresh while we waited.  The staff was quite friendly and helpful.  I'm excited about going back soon.
Best chicken shawarma sandwich in the US! Their other dishes are great as well. Not a fancy place but great food

Wow that was really good. Had the #6 beef kabob. Picked a soda out of the nearby fridge. Great people watching, this place caters to a truly international crowd. The tightly packed tables gave it a communal vibe. I'll be back!
If you're a fan of Middle Eastern food, this is the place for you! Though small,it packs a big punch with its robust menu. Portions and prices were exceptional.... Will be a favorite....

Izzat for Mayor! While the food at La Shish Kabob is undeniably delicious, the owner, Izzat, is what makes this spot really special. Rarely can I even open the door myself before Izzat is there, flinging it open, welcoming us in with a big smile and warm greetings. He is truly a Charlotte gem, adding not only great food but out of this world hospitality and kindness to our community. If the restaurant isn't totally packed when you visit, take some time to chat with Izzat and learn his story about moving his restaurant (and family) from Jerusalem to east Charlotte. It's one of resiliency and hard work that will make you love him and La Shish even more than you did before.   Once inside, I always have order anxiety as the smells of slow roasting shawarma and kabobs envelope me. It's impossible not to order hummus, so just go ahead and plan on that. Freshly made and creamy, with olive oil drizzled on top, it's the stuff dreams are made of. I also love the babaganoush (roasted eggplant spread/dip) and tabbouleh (minced parsley, mint, olive oil, and who knows what else goodness), and falafel. Oh, the falafel! Also totally dreamy. In case you're not full just reading this, the chicken shawarma is also delish and served with french fries that are perfect to dip in the garlic mayo. So, pretty much, just order one of everything and plan to take a lot home to snack on for days after.
Food is ok, not the best but much better than other places. They charged 2.99 for extra garlic sauce which was un called for; otherwise ok

The best food mediterranean food in Charlotte.  The shawarma is amazing, the hummus is rich and delicious, and the falafel is incredible and perfectly fried.  It is beyond fantastic with a wonderful owner and food that is authentic, reasonably priced, and you should go out of your way to eat hear as you will not be dissapointed!

First time we visited, it was packed and had a great energy. We got enough food to feed 8 people but there was only two of us and completely worth it! The leftovers were just as great! We will be back!
Great fresh food. I always enjoy come big here. It has been awhile but so happy I picked up some kabob dinners and salads to go tonight! Yum!

I finally tried this place out with a girl friend and brought my husband later the same week. It far exceeded my expectations! I have been able to try a few things on the menu now and everything has been delicious. Get anything with lamb and you'll be pleased :)

i went here for the recent Taste of the World jaunt.    I've never eaten lamb before, but it was a huge piece on the bone, that the minute I put my fork on it, fell away from the bone beautifully!    I devoured it quickly and now I can't wait to go back to try some other kebab things!  The sauces were delicious!  I loved the Baba Ganoush (sp) as well!

Just ordered via PostMates...... who makes Chicken Shwarma without the pickle??? And,..... no marinara sauce included with my Mozzarella Sticks!? 3 stars only because the portion sizes were immense! Fries, as a side order to Mozzarella sticks??? Not rushing to order from here again...

It was late on that hot and muggy Carolina Friday, and most places were closed, but their sign caught my eye. The smell of falafel was a delicious draw, so we decided to stop in.   This is not a restaurant. This is a hub.   The small restaurant was full of good sights, smells, and the chatter of friendly people in languages I didn't understand. Women in headscarves talked animatedly to eachother while scooping up laughing children to sit on their laps. Families talked to all tables as they sat down to delicious food.  Behind the counter, herbed beef, chicken, and lamb sizzled as music from Jerusalem sounded over the system.   Meet Izzat. He opened La Shish Kabob about two months ago after moving his family here from Jerusalem. When he invites you into his restaurant, it's like he's inviting you into his home. We gladly took a seat.  SERVICE: Astounding. Very pleasant and hospitable, and when I realized that I had accidentally ordered something with onions and green peppers (my friend is allergic), they instantly made another one and apologized even though it was my err. Instead of the original lamb kebab that was ordered, he made something that was a little different to better suit my friend's food requirements, without even being asked. And it was delicious.  FOOD: If you've never experienced good Middle Eastern food, experience it here. They have all of the classics, from falafel to baba ghannouj. The tabouli was out of this world (so much better than I make, I'm going to have to snag his recipe), with that clean and fresh parsley, lemon and olive oil flavor.  The kebab wraps (chicken and lamb) were flavorful and huge. They also sell the brand of mango nectar there that tastes like you're drinking a whole mango. Delicious. The baklavah and other goodies in the case looked mouth-watering, but I was too full. That comes on round 2.  PRICE: This is the awesome part. A heaping portion of tabouli for two, two lamb kebab wraps, one chicken kebab wrap, and 4 mango drinks comes out to: $26. So cheap for not only the portion size, but the quality and freshness as well.  When you walk into this place, you can feel that it's good people. If you stay, you'll quickly realize that it's good people, AND great food. When it's all over, you'll also see that it's all for a really affrodable price. I highly suggest giving this place some love, because it's one of the few places that will give it back.

First let me say I love the atmosphere of this place. It feels very homey, and the owner is very welcoming and helpful with recommendations. I give it 3 stars, because the food was good enough, but not amazing. Ordered lamb kabob, lamb gyro with fries,, and baba ganoush. The lamb kabob was full of flavor, and the meat was very tender. Could've used a little more meat in the sandwich, but nothing to complain about. The lamb gyro was good, nothing out of the usual. The fries however that came with it were soggy and undercooked. The best thing was the baba ganoush. They also offer prepared foods and desserts like baklava as well as other Lebanese canned and dry foods.
This place is authentic, delicious and a true gem here in Charlotte. Recommend anyone to come here and finish with a desert. You won't regret it

Really good food!  I've eaten at quite a few Mediterranean places and I enjoyed this one.  I had the gyro sandwich, it was delicious.  I prefer the gyro carved from the spit, but this was not.  The pita was fresh and the cucumber salad was yummy along with the sauce.  My wife had the New York schwarma and loved the flavors.  She said it was different from others she's had, but very good.  My son had the ground beef  kabob and loved it.   I had some too excellent flavor.  My wife and I enjoyed the lentil soup, but my son did not.  The owner was very nice.  The location is busy, not the best location in a strip mall.  The decor is pretty minimal and the buffet tables take up the back of the restaurant even when not in use.  Maybe a good carryout place, but not a terrible place to eat.  The food makes it all worth it.

Let's be straight here. The place doesn't look like much. The mall it is in doesn't look great, and the logo looks like some elementary school kids - albeit talented ones - scribbled it on the brick. But if you give it a chance, you will find that it is worth a stop.  On the inside, the service is second-to-none, and even on your first visit you are treated like family. Which is not to say the family that you don't want around (though if you act that way and they kick you out, it's your fault, so consider yourself warned). No, they are warmly welcoming and help you through the menu of options, which can certainly seem challenging if this is your first time.  When you get to the food, it's almost like an old diner, with an open kitchen and that's great but it also means there aren't a lot of tables - a better option may be to take the food to go - only then it would not be hot off the grill, so you can decide the best course of action for your own needs.  If you find a spot, sit down and dig into it right away so you get some of the goodness when it is fresh, and it's definitely a great spot to give a shot, elementary logo and all.

One of my favorite places in Charlotte. It's kind of a hole in the wall, but the food is solid. Go for the shawarma wrap with fries, shawarma with hummus, or the lamb shanks.   The shawarma is seasoned perfectly with allspice and lemon; it's shaved off the spit and finished on the griddle. Usually it's amazing... There have been a few times lately that the chicken has been a little dry, but I remedy that with an extra helping of their garlic sauce and the lemon-olive oil concoction on the tables.   The lamb shank is stewed and it falls off the bone.  The lentil soup is delicious.  They have menu items like burgers, Philly cheesesteaks, lamb cheesesteak, etc. and I'd advise you to stay away.

Oh!! I fell in love with their chicken shawarma!! One of THE BEST around Charlotte! My husband ordered lamb shanks and they were heavenly, cooked really well and awesomely flavored. We are definitely coming back whenever we are reminded of Mediterranean, which would be every month :-)

I came here after seeing some rave reviews on Yelp. I ordered over the phone for pick up. The owner said it would be ready in 10 minutes and it sure was. I had the appetizer combo with hummus, falafel, and grape leaves. I had a side order of pita. The portions were generous. I really enjoyed my order and I would like to try the shawarma and kebabs next time I visit this establishment. The restaurant itself, is nothing fancy. It's good to note that they have had 100% sanitation rating the last three years. The owner is very kind! The prices are great.

The food is good but the owner very unpleasant.  Charges $4.50 for just rice and just French fries. As if consumers don't know this is one of the cheapest things to make/sale. Making a 400% profit. How sad. He should let his daughters run the business much nicer and smarter
Oooooo this place was so good. The owner was so nice and very friendly.   Order the Lamb  Philly with the Falafel wrap. My 1st time and I am ready to come back. Excited to tell my friends

I decided to try this place for lunch with some co-workers.  My food was extremely dry and they charged me more than what the menu actually says online.  I called the manager back and he stated the prices were wrong, very unprofessional.  I paid 10 bucks for some fries and a shawarma.  I could've gotten the shawarma by itself and paid 5 bucks.  I guess the fries were 5 bucks.  Oh my sandwich was just meat nothing like the description he stated it was right.
It is a little far to me so I can't go every week. Excellent taste for the kebabs...I would do take outs here.
La Shis KaBOMB !  Cheap...fresh....excellent flavors...nice people !!  Ya just cannot beat it !

Went for lunch on a Sunday - bustling with people for the buffet. Ordered the chicken shawarma plate, a hot wrap filled to the brim with rotisserie chicken. Definitely affordable and delicious - a must stop if you're looking for something different from Latin in the Eastland area.

This place is awesome. I was visiting Charlotte in June 2012 and my brother brought us here for dinner. The food was so good that we came back for our last meal here again before flying back to CA.  I would recommend the whole lamb leg or the cheese steak sandwich. Their sheesh kabab was very delicious. The owner was very accommodating to our family

I love this place. The owner is really nice and the food is awesome. They are super clean and it's always fresh. It's food made with love. They have a selection of meats and vegetarian dishes as well. I go every week and never have anything but an awesome experience.
This food is amazing better than fine dining restaraunts that I've been to. Best lamb sharks I've ever had!
Decent food rice was real dry. Pieces of chicken where real bland maybe just not the best dish to try. It was the chicken kabobs with rice and salad

Have been here a couple times now and have had mostly good experiences. I tried the kibbeh, tabouli, hummus, lamb kabob sandwich and shwarma. I've enjoyed everything, especially the hummus, except for the shwarma. Honestly, I've had better. But that's not enough to keep me from going back. The place always smells so awesome and there's still a million things on the menu I haven't tried yet!
I am not sure what I love more, the people or the food.  The owner is amazing.  The food is amazing.  The atmosphere is amazing.  It is an outstanding place.  I cannot say enough good!

The best middle eastern joint in Charlotte, hands down. They recently remodeled to include more seating inside the restaurant, which much better accommodates the volume of customers. I usually get a wrap and the veggie plate. The chicken shawarma is always cooked perfectly and has wonderful flavor while still being tender. The veggie plate is a HUGE amount of food, which I get to share with at least one other person. The lintel soup is so tasty, and welcome in the cold months. The price is right, especially for the quality and quantity of food and the owner is one of the nicest I've had the pleasure of talking to in Charlotte. If you're not eating here, you're doing it wrong.

If not the best, one of the best middle eastern restaurants I've ever been. The owner is the chef as well. I had shawarma platter and it was awesome. Service is very friendly and you feel at home. I'm recommending this restaurant to all who want to try new taste and those who love kabob.
I've been shish kabobed into this place .. amazing flavors, something new to me and the charcoal grill on the meats is awesome :)

I love this dirty, small, simple yet delicious place. I lived in Berlin for a while and loved these places. If you are there for quality food and do not mind that the eye will see some greasy cooking and a bit rundown environment than you are in for a treat. This place is as authentic as it can get. Unfortunately, it is not located close to my place, but I think about this place a lot and cannot wait to return. They serve wonderful shwarma sandwiches even with pickles in them, the way I am used to it from the Lebanese places I used to eat at in Berlin. Great prices and many different options. The staff is super friendly. There are not many tables, but it is always possible to get a spot. There are also a few tables outdoor, however, it is not equipped for large groups.  I love this place and will continue to return and highly recommend the food quality and options in terms of Middle Eastern food.

Not bad at all if you can ignore the less than posh ambience?  falafel very tasty but little dry, likewise for the chicken shawarma!  The Lentil soup is extremely pgood with a lil kick spice with a Turkish hint of flavor.  We ll be back to try other Arab delights little pricy FYI

I actually went to this restaurant because of the Yelp reviews. The reviews were so correct. The people were so friendly and the food was delicious. I am so glad I found a really good resturant that is close to my job. I have shared the menu with all of my co-workers because they said my food was smelling wonderful throughout the office.

What are the other reviewers talking about?  This place is horrible!  Do not eat here!!  We went there for lunch on a Sunday.  The place itself looked shabby but it had a lot of people there eating so we decided to give it a try because of the great reviews on Yelp.  We ordered our food at the register and payed for it.  Then I noticed that the cook was handling the money with gloves on but then goes back to cooking without changing gloves!!  I was pretty grossed out but I figured we had already paid for the food so I was going to eat it and pray that we don't get sick from it!  The food was not that great!  We barely ate any of it!!  Then after we had finished we went back to our car and we were sitting there for a minute in the parking lot looking up directions and the cook knocks on our car window!  We opened the door and he says "You not pay me!"  So we told him that we payed when we ordered the food and then he just walked away!  What a strange experience!!

A/C not working well, 82 inside and 96 outside.  Middle Eastern food served buffet style for $14.95/plate, plus the cost of drinks.  Food was just ok, Ant liked the different selections of chicken.  Nice owner that greeted us as we came in.
First time here and this place is pretty good. The prices on food is reasonable.  The lentil soup is delicious, and lamb kabob was cooked right.

I'm a huge fan of Middle Eastern food, and La Shish Kebob is pretty good.  I have to warn you - La Shish Kebob is not in the nicest strip mall and the restaurant itself is extremely small.  But please, don't let their location or interior deter you from giving them a try.   We were enthusiastically greeted by the owner and led to our table.  We ordered the 8-piece falafel platter as our appetizer.  For dinner, I ordered the vegetarian combo (with hommos, baba ghannouj and yalanji), and my hubby ordered the mixed grill kabob (with lamb, chicken, and beef).  I also ordered the special rice for $1 on the side.  Every single thing we ordered was absolutely delicious.  My only complaint was with how they delivered our food.  Since my vegetarian plate did not need to be cooked, it was delivered first and placed in the center of the table.  I thought - what, this is my dinner, right?  So, my hubby and I ended up sharing it while we waited for the falafel and his kabobs to arrive. The falafel plate was huge, outstanding in flavor, and lighter in texture than we are accustomed to (in a good way). We also shared my hubby's meat plate when it arrived, and it ended up being my favorite - the meat was really tender and juicy.  Frankly, I have never had chicken or lamb this delicious before.    The owner stopped by several times to see how we were doing, and even gave my hubby a special hot sauce that he just loved.  We could tell he took great pride in his place.  I'm only dropping a star because on subsequent visits, they were busier, and so the service suffered.  It's also a tiny place inside, and hard to enjoy your meal when it's really busy.
Oh wow the philly cheese steak is amazing. The owner had the best memory when you place orders. He doesn't even need to know your name. Pick up orders are fresh and ready quick.

The food at this place is amazing!   We had the grilled lamb kabob platter,  Lebanon salad and the vegetarian combo which has hummus, grape leaves, baba ghannouj and falafel. The food is authentic, delicious and fresh, all at a very low price. If you're looking for great authentic Mediterranean food this is the place to visit!

Hours are great, especially if you are out late and don't want the same old fast food.  I read a lot of good things about this place.  I was only in for a quick bite, I had babaganoush and pita. The prices are great and the quantity of dip is good. If you go, ask for more pita because I ran out before the dip! Great flavor!! Great service!

Ridiculously nice & welcoming staff, great food and inexpensive. Most ethnic eateries aren't as welcoming if you aren't from the country or don't speak the language, this guy calls everyone "Friend". I got the chicken shawarma, baklava, and falafel wrap. I will return!

It's been several months since I've stopped by because while the food is usually excellent, one of the cooks actually took my order and bagged my food. What a let down. I paid $10 for an appetizer falafel and a side of tabouli. The tabouli side is supposed to come with a pita which was absent from the bag as well as no fork or spoon to eat it with. It's probably better to eat in as I have gotten excellent service from who I assume is the owner. Since I live across from the airport, I probably won't go out of my way.

Wife and I went for a Tuesday lunch.  Had the buffet , not bad. 4 meats, 2 soups, plain and seasoned rice, 3 sauces, hummus, and couple of salads.  A bit pricy for the minimal spread, but the food was good.  Nothing spicy, some needed more spice.  Overall, we will be back, but probably order from the menu.

Stopped by this place for lunch last week. My first visit. Not much to look at but I wasn't there for the decor. I ordered a falafel wrap to go. Wow! Great flavors. The wrap was outstanding! The price was nice too, $3.99. I need to go back and try the shawarma. One tip: if you have a job that requires you to talk to the public, the falafel wrap might not be the best choice if you are on a lunch break. Plenty of onions & garlic in this one. I'll be back for another go on my day off!!

Very good prices. The meat is prepared well. The only complaint is the rice...it's kind of stale and flavorless. Other than that these guys have perfected quick-sit-down Middle Eastern food for Charlotte standards.

Oh, how I love la shish! I have only ever had the chicken shawarma and haven't tried anything else because it is awesome. For $7.99, you get two small wraps and fries. I don't really eat the fries but that's because the wraps are sooooo yummy. The chicken is so flavorful and the Arabic pita bread is delicious. There is a garlic sauce on the side that is potent and amazing!    My boyfriend likes their cheese steak so for those who don't want authentic middle eastern, they got something for you! He also normally eats one of my chicken shawarma wraps and likes it. #chickenshawarmaalldayeveryday  The highlight of this place is the man at the register, who I assume is the owner. He is always so kind, gracious and friendly. Definitely go and enjoy!  Update: since my initial post, I've tried items other than the chicken shawarma and I did not love it as much. Back to my usual...

My tastebuds will never be the same! For appetizer we had the combo appetizer (you pick 3) with hummus, grape leaves and kibbeh. Oh my word y'all. The hummus was so creamy and rich, grape leaves were fantastic, but seriously, the kibbeh- I can't put it into words how amazing this fried little meat wad is! Haha. Next was entrees.. Lamb shanks were falling off the bone and cooked PERFECTLY. The marbling was to die for and the meat was so juicy. The lamb kabob is cooked differently but equally as awesome. Finally we ended with desert- baklava, the owner said he had just made it that morning. I almost broke up with my boyfriend over the last piece- flaky, light, cream filled center, and not too sweet which is so rare to find in a desert! It was phenomenal!  Thank you La Shish for a wonderful, quick, and affordable dinner!

Mmmmm. What more can I say? The meats are delicious, the lamb kabob is my favorite, the spices are so good. The lentil soup is bangin' and that little side of creamy stuff to put in it...do it! The meat plattera come with a huge pile of rice and it's amazing! Just eat here. The owner is awesome and so friendly, as most of the middle eastern places here are.

I've been here couple of times.  They expanded their menu and the place got bigger. The lamb is really good and very consistent.  The personnel and the owner especially is very nice, he will always greet you and will make you feel at home . One of my favorite places for middle eastern food
Terrible terrible terrible restaurant. The quality of food is really bad. The service is not good at all, they don't even bring you a drink.
Most favorite Mediterranean place in Charlotte. We drive 20 mins twice a week for their lamb shanks!!!!!!!

Inspired by multiple viewings of The Avengers back in the summer, my husband and I decided we really wanted to try shawarma. Although we'd never had it, Tony Stark's obsession and the ensuing post-credits scene were enough to spark our own shawarma craze. We were driving past La Shish Kabob one day and I noticed the neon sign indicating our quest could find its resolution there. I remembered reading many glowing reviews of the place here on Yelp. Within a day or so we had found our shawarma salvation, and it's less than a five-minute drive from home.  This unassuming hole in the wall is cramped and chaotic, but it is home to some of the best Middle Eastern food in town. Don't let the lack of fancy atmosphere steer you away from what could be your new favorite joint.  We now eat here or get takeaway at least two or three times a month. Yes, the shawarma is outstanding. Their falafel is the best I've ever had and the hummus is high up there, too. As a lifelong dolmas aficionado, I have to say theirs are the best I've had since I was a kid and visited an Egyptian family that my dad knew. My husband and I love to get the appetizer plate, always with hummus and dolmas. Everything we've tried has been incredible.

This place reminds me of my college days in London. Nothing better than leaving the pub and making your way over to the kabob shop. Seriously, this place is open late, the service is friendly, the food is amazing, and it is cheap. I have never eaten in because lets be real who wants to eat a kebab in a shop when you could have it on your couch with Netflix?   The beef is charred and tasty, the tahini is on point, and the tabouli is to die for. Seriously check this place out! I'm curious about their sweets, those will definitely be on my to do list for next time.

Love this place! You're gonna walk in and be like what in the world.. I know because that was me. Middle eastern is in my blood so finding a good middle eastern place can be tricky. This place is great. I recommend the Kafta, Hummus, Mixed grill, tabouli, and for desert make sure you get Kenfi! So good!

I don't come here often, I honestly don't find it very tasty, it's ok-ish, but when I have a hankering for Falafel and my favorite Mediterranean food restaurant is closed, well then, you gotta settle. I am not saying it's dreadful, no it's decent, they could do with tasting what they cook more often. I have found the food to be either over seasoned or bland-ish. Overall, I will come back because, I love falafel. Oh I do enjoy their red lentil soup, much! Sadly, they do not carry it often.

Talk about a hidden gem!! My weekends are not complete until I have had at least one meal from La Shish... it's usually a Sunday afternoon takeout. Basmati rice so perfectly cooked, to go with the perfectly seasoned chicken kabobs (the lamb kabobs are good too, I'm just a bigger fan of the chicken ones)  Warm pita bread with fresh falafels, topped with hummus, fries and garlic dip on the side. It doesn't get any better than this. In my experience, the food has always been fresh and flavorful, and the portions are big! Really great value for your money. There's something so wonderful about food that's simple, affordable & downright delicious - For complete soul, palette & pocket satisfaction - check out La Shish!

This place is everything that is RIGHT about the middle east. Great service, Great food, a crappy atmosphere that just screams "We are serving amazing food not supplying comfy chairs".   I cant wait to return, truly a hidden gem.

Visited this past Friday evening with my husband and 4 yr old son. We were welcomed and the menu vs the buffet was explained.  My dad had recommended the lamb shank, which I ordered, and my husband decided on the chicken kabobs.  I would have given this place a 5 star review for my lamb shank.  It was fork tender and packed full of flavor.  My son and I devoured it, yes my 4 yr old son loves lamb :)  My husband's dish, on the other hand, was missing the vegetables and the chicken was bland.  No strong flavor or marinade.  It was a disappointment.  We should have asked about the vegetables but being new to the place, we decided against it.  Also, the falafel was delicious too.  I will definitely go back but not sure if I can convince my husband to.  All in all, have the lamb!

Some of the best middle eastern food around Charlotte, looks like a hole in the wall but being from NY you know that is where some of the best quality food is served. I have come here probably a dozen times since moving to Charlotte and not once have I been disappointed. Dine in is equally as enjoyable, again do not mind the atmosphere the people around you are all enjoying the food and conversation, and the staff is extremely kind. One of my top 5 food spots in the Queen City.

I love this place, first it's like a Palestinian deli in NYC, they have freshly made salads, hummus, also Cornish hen, and THR portions a HUGE...so you need to be hungry! The food it's fantastic and you can have also amazing desert! Won't be disappointed!

I just wish I had found this place sooner. Love it!  I have been starved for good Middle Eastern food in Charlotte.  This place is By Far the best that I have tried.  The price are extremely low and the quality is exceptionally high. The portions are large. How they can sell two lamb shanks for such a low price is beyond me.  You don't come here for the atmosphere.  You come here for the food.  But I did think that the diversity of the patrons was very interesting. I've probably eaten here 6 or so times now and every time I have been extremely impressed.   Just try La Shish Kabob.  You won't be disappointed.

This place has now grown a buffett.  it is a little expensive at 15 adult and 9 for childrens but this place still gets 5 stars bc the buffet quality is still the same quality as menu items.  food is fresh and amazing
I love everything about this place. The lentil soup is good and so are the lamb gyros. Can't wait to go for the buffet.

DAMN YOU EXPECTATIONS!  After all these raving reviews, I dragged my newly-found-food-loving boyfriend past my usual quickie hole in the wall middle eastern place on Central Ave. to try out this new hole in the wall for an early dinner.  The place looks promising as we walked in: small, nothing fancy, and a table of middle eastern diners... my thought was, SCORE!  With all the options it was hard to make a decision.  But I was determined to try the lentil soup so I ended up getting the half roast chicken with 2 sides, one side being the soup and the other being the special rice ($7.99).  He ordered a falafel sandwich wrap ($2.99) and a chicken chicken shawarma sandwich wrap ($3.99).  Lentil soup was different, almost has a hint of squash taste, plus it's my first non-green lentil soup, but it was otherwise yummy and perfect for an unexpected day of cold weather.  Then the rest of the food arrived.  The 2 sandwich wraps were huge for the price... but disappointingly they had more fillers (tomato/cucumber/etc.) than the meat and the sauce so the taste got washed off a little.  The falafel one was definitely better; it was perfectly crispy fried and well seasoned.  Meanwhile my half chicken and rice looked impressive.  I swear there's enough rice to feed a family of four on the plate.  But as I forked my way into the chicken, it was unbelievably DRY!  I seriously could not even eat the wing because it was bone dry.  The skin looked yummy golden brown but lacked flavor... so if the skin had no flavor, imagine how bland the meat was.  It's so dry that even the dark meat was getting tough, which I didn't even think was possible.  What a let down :(  The only saving grace of my plate was the garlic sauce... it looked like a lump of mayo, but it was garlic-y.  I smeared it all over everything to give my plate some much needed taste.  Since it's my 1st visit, I am not going to write it off yet.  I think next time I'll give their kafta a try.  But my suggestion is to stay away from the chicken.  The only other high point of yesterday's visit was the discovery of a newly open Nile Grocery and Ethiopian Restaraunt sign that was being put up as I was fighting a losing battle with my chicken.

This place is the best kind of hole-in-the-wall. As a Middle Easterner in Charlotte, I was thrilled that my friend brought me here. Don't be afraid of the lack of glamour--this place has heart and the food is cooked with lots of love and clearly cherished recipes. This is authentic Middle Eastern food with hard working staff and chefs who were so kind.   The flavors of the food were impeccable....shout out to the tabbouli (so fresh) and the richness of the way they prepare all of their meats. The portions are substantial. I would love to try some of their Friday specials sometime. I highly recommend the meat pies. I had plenty of food to bring home, and I know I'll be visiting again when I need my fix of Middle Eastern food.

Go there! Get the lamb kabob. Pay the extra buck for the special rice. Ask for all the sauces because they're all amazing. We got the appetizer sampler thing and everything was delicious. The lentil soup is crazy good. You CANNOT go wrong here. Tons of awesome, fresh food at a very reasonable price. Oh, and don't expect atmosphere because there is none but it seems to be mainly a takeout place anyway.

This is so much better than any of the the greek/middle eastern chains out there so skip then and head here.  I love their Vegetarian Combo it has everything you would want on it.  I have never been there for their buffet which is on my list.  They are great for take out and the portions are very large.  Most orders come with bread and ask for extra garlic butter because it is great.  The owner is also super nice and if your order is ever wrong he makes sure to make up for it.

If you're looking some pretty good food, La Shish is your place!  The food here is delicious and priced very well. The portions are large, so sharing is definitely an option (that is if you can pull yourself away from your yummy dish).  The restaurant is cozy with a really friendly manager, he's very helpful and kind. I've been here a few times, and I think I finally have a favorite. Shwarma's are great, and the homemade hummus is something I could eat by the spoonful O_o !!!   I love getting the 3 Kabob plate which comes with lamb, chicken, and kafta. KAFTA KAFTA, so so so yummy. I mean I pretty much ate all of that first, then the lamb, followed by whatever chicken I could fit into my belly. This is a good choice if you want to share or try a few different things.   The food here is always on point and I've never had a bad experience. I'm a huge fan of La Shish Kabob, and will be back soon.

We came here as a party of 10 after our families decided to meet up in the area.  I read so many good things about this place. The place is small but, even late at night, there was pretty good business.  The owner looked straight out of The Hobbit trilogies and wasn't super warm and fuzzy.    I think this place was too hyped up in my head after reading the glowing reviews. We had taken our food back to the hotel and unfortunately, the food did not live up to the hype.  I don't think anyone finished their meal.  I love me some spices but the entire meal was entirely too overly spiced.  It might have been due to the meat tasting a bit off...so maybe the heavy hand in spices was to offset that taste/fact?  I was especially excited about kibbeh being on the menu but instantly disappointed when I popped in the first bite.  Too bad I ordered a bunch of everyone.  We are huge fans of kafta but we could barely finish ours.  The kids even quit early and they loooooiiove kafta/kufta/kubideh.  Overall, the portions were decent and the food ok if I hadn't had anything to compare it to.  Maybe this was just an off night since I'm sure the reviews are glowing for a reason.

La Shish is where it's at for some quick and yummy gyros or hummus, kabobs and just good meat in general. They just recently opened up another side to have more seating (like over double than what was in there before). IT IS NOT FANCY. So don't go in there on your high horse. It's all about speed with them and I appreciate that. Ask them anything if you have questions or don't know what something is. You get huge portions. Just give them your order, go grab a drink from the cooler and pick a table. The owner is really nice, he has a huge family so I am happy to see their success in this spot, it is always busy (hence why the expanded.)  My fave is that bomb hummus with some grilled chicken, delicious!

Horrible.... I am so sorry to have to write this, but it turns out to be a must.   Inconsistency can kill a restaurant and it just killed it for me at La Shish. Still shaking my head over this one.   So this is the second time (mind you in a row) that my order was horrible. And now, they screwed up my mothers order -- she is 100 times worse than I when it comes to food, but we both behave the same... once,  okay we will try it again... twice, more than like not again. And if we decided to try it again, it will be a day far away.    I ordered the Arabic Shawarma chicken wrap (both times) and it was bland ass boring and last night out right gross. If I wanted plain chicken thrown on a flat grill with no seasoning, I could of did that myself thank you. And the tahini -- was that mayo or tahini... BOTH TIMES. Argh.   My mother ordered the Lamb Kebob's and the cook added so much hot sauce she couldn't eat it. Mind you she loves hot sauce, but on a Lamb kebob, that should be the customers choice, not the cook going rogue! (the Kebob, which she always orders has NEVER had hot sauce on it before)   And the hommos... smh... there was so much sumac, it was inedible. It was so bitter.   What a shame... I love their prices and I did love the flavor. My mom thinks its the cook... the young one is not supervised, where the older one understands the flavor and seasoning level.   Only reason it got two stars is because my fathers order was ok -- he got the vegetarian wrap.   Another one bites the dust.

All these raving reviews are 100% right!   Tried La Shish Kabob for the first time last night. I've been curious after seeing it rated as one of the best places to get hummus in Charlotte by Charlotte Agenda.  We ordered the following items:  Hummos Dip Appetizer Grape Leaves Appetizer  Kofta Kabob Wrap Mixed Grilled Kabob Entrée  Everything was so delicious! The hummos dip was served with huge pieces of fresh pita, we had our food delivered by Ubereats--I can only imagine how good the pita is when served right there. Very tasty and very much deserving of it's title as one of the best in Charlotte.  Grape Leaves were served cold, which I prefer--I've had them warm and wasn't as big of a fan. Stuffed with rice, tomato and parsley they were really yummy. Appetizer comes with 6 in it.  Kofta Kabob Wrap was HUGE--wrapped in warm pita and served with with lettuce, tomato, pickles, onion and hummus. Was especially great with the hot sauce provided.   Mixed Grilled Kabob Entrée was the absolutely favorite. You get to try chicken, lamb and kofta served on a giant bed of rice. The portion size was insane, had it for lunch today! This is also served with a fresh small salad.  Try this place out, you won't regret it! Price was low and portions were big!
I got a large take out order for a party and the food as well as the service was very good.  Prices are ok too.

They have the best Falafel I ever had... by far.   I have been eating Falafel my whole life in NYC an LI and would of been happy just to find a place that even offered it in Charlotte... but this place totally blew away my mediocre expectations.  I haven't had anything else here because I can not pass up on the amazing Falafel.  Oh, and it's $3!!!

Just for the record absolutely hands-down the best middle Eastern cuisine I've ever had still to date ! Me and a buddy AJ and his family went here couple years ago now ...damn good food omg it's really amazing.. Yes there is other places in town but after revisiting this place again it's just better I think. You have to check out the Kibbeh, Falafel, Chicken Shawarma, Kafta Kabobs....!!  They also have a few desserts but my favorite is Baklava. If your a coffee person try the real deal Turkish coffee .....You won't regret it you'll thank me later ...enjoy!!!!
This is my favorite Middle Eastern restaurant, great, authentic food, great service, friendly proprietor, great value.  Love eating here or getting to go.  Everything is good.  What more can I say?

This is some phenomenal Mediterranean food that won't break the bank. I have eaten here a few times and it leaves me always wanting more of their food. Each item is perfectly prepared with a great mixture of spices and flavors.  The one tip I will share in this review is that all Mediterranean food is very similar, but it's also very different. So if you're looking for a specific dish you might not find it here because while it's Mediterranean food, it's really Lebanese. This creates dishes with slightly different spices but still a delight for any Mediterranean food lover.
Amazing and authentic Mediterranean cuisine! The baba ghannouj is delicious. The owner is so attentive and will make sure you love what you get! Fast service.
